apart.core.network — Network and Network Manager¶

This module contains classes managing the network.

The class Network represents a network, and class NetworkManager the manager of the network.The manager is responsible for triggering the different phases of the network (coded in NetPhase), and starting the nodes processes. The network itself contains the topology graph and the list of nodes that compose the network.

This module does not contain code properly relatin to the protocol. All the code of the protocol, and the behavior of nodes, is coded in module node.

This module also defines the SimulationException exception.

exception apart.core.network.SimulationException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when an error occurs due to the handling SimPy simulation, or during the lifetime of the network

class apart.core.network.Network(net_manager, simpy_env, sim_params, net_params)[source]¶

Bases: object

The network which nodes are part of.

This class is repsonsible for:
  • Managing the set of nodes
  • Creating and managing the topology graph

The constructor creates the topology graph, creates the nodes (Node objects), generates a subset of corrupted nodes,

Parameters:
  • net_manager (NetworManager) – the manager of the network
  • simpy_env (simpy.Environment) – the simpy environment
  • sim_params (SimulationParams) – set of parameters for the simulation
  • net_params (NetworkParams) – set of parameters for the network (nb nodes, etc.)
draw_routes(*args, blocking=False)[source]¶

Draw the routes between one or several pairs of nodes

For each sender-receiver pair in argument, the function will draw all the routes that the sender knows towards the receiver.

Parameters:
  • args (list of 2-tuple) – a list of 2-tuple, each specifying a source and a destination
  • blocking (bool, optional) – whether or not the python program should be stopped until the gtk window is closed, or should continue to run in the background
draw_topology_graph(blocking=True)[source]¶

Draw the topology graph of the network

Creates a new gtk window, and displays the graph in it. This function can be called in a blocking fashion or not, in which case the program (and the network simulation) are stopped while the gtk window is open.2

Parameters:blocking (*) – whether or not the python program should be stopped until the gtk window is closed, or should continue to run in the background

Generates a random set of corrupted nodes.

Parameters:
  • nb_nodes (int) – total number of nodes in the network
  • corruption_ratio (float) – float between 0 and 1, representing the percent of corrupted nodes in the network
  • topology_graph (networkx.Graph) – the topology graph of the network
static gen_topology_graph(nb_nodes)[source]¶

Makes a random (but fully connected) physical graph of the appropriate number of nodes.

Uses the networkx graph library.

Returns:a topology graph (random connected graph)
Return type:networkx.Graph
batching_round¶

int – Returns the current network batching round

In a real-world network, each node would manage its own batching counter. Although all nodes have the same batching interval, skewing in their clocks imply that different nodes can be in different rounds (all nodes are not perfectly in sync). This function returns the maximum batching round over all nodes.

Note that in this “implementation” with SimPy, all node clocks are perfectly in sync, and thus all nodes are exactly in the same batching round.

corrupted_nodes¶

list of Node – The set of corrupted nodes

nb_nodes¶

int – Number of nodes in the networks

network_uid¶

int – The network unique id

nodes¶

list of Node – The list of nodes in the network. The list is passed by reference, but should not be modified. Nodes inside the list can be modified.

params¶

apart.core.network.NetworkParams – The network parameters

routing_tables_sqlite_db_cursor¶

sqlite3.Cursor – The sqlite3 database cursor internally used by the node’s routing table implementations

For statistics computing, and inspection of routing tables after the run of the network, it is sometimes useful to directly access the sqlite3 cursor.

timestamp¶

int – Returns the SimPy simulation time, rounded to the next integer

topology_graph¶

networkx.Graph – The network’s underlying topology graph

class apart.core.network.NetworkManager(sim_params, net_params)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class modeling a network manager.

The network manager is responsible for:

  • Creating and managing a Network instance
  • Checking the termination of the topology dissemination and oriented communication phases
  • Managing the (uniqueness of) the cid, rcid, and ocomid
  • Gathering the statistics on the network

Note that after a simulation of the network, run_simulation() returns an instance of this class. That is, it returns the network manager, containing the network in its final state, and the attribute net_params. The latter is particularly useful to extract information on the network and the protocol (such as the total number of routes proposed, or the latency of communications).

Parameters:
  • sim_params (SimulationParams) – set of parameters for the simulation
  • net_params (NetworkParams) – set of parameters for the network (nb nodes, etc.)
check_network_idleness()[source]¶

Check of all nodes in the network are idle, and takes the adequate course of actions.

The network becomes idle a first time at the end of topology dissemination. At this point, if the simulation asks to perform the oriented communication phase, the network manager moves to this phase, and notifies the nodes. Otherwise, it stops all nodes.

start()[source]¶

Starts the network. Calls start_topology_dissemination()

start_oriented_communication_phase(ocom_sessions_per_node=None)[source]¶

Start the oriented communication phase in the network.

Using the ocom_session_per_node argument if one is provided, or the oriented_communication_sessions attribute of the simulation parameters, provides each node with a set of sessions to run as end-sender.

Raises:SimulationException – if the oriented communication parameter is not well formed
start_topology_dissemination()[source]¶

Starts the network.

Basically registers the nodes as SimPy processes, and starts the SimPy environment

Raises:SimulationException – if the network is not in its initiation phase, e.g. if the topology dissemination already took place
is_running¶

bool – True is the network is running (in the sense of SimPy)

NetworkStats – The network statistics instance

Network – The network instance

network_phase¶

NetPhase – The current phase the network is in

sim_params¶

SimulationParams – The simulation parameters

class apart.core.network.NetworkParams(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class grouping all the parameters of the network

Accepts keyword arguments, corresponding to the network parameters, to replace the default values

update_params(**kwargs)[source]¶

Updates the parameters after instanciation of the object.

Accepts keyword arguments, corresponding to the network parameters. Only keyword arguments that match a valid attribute of the class are taken into accounts. Others are simply ignored silently.

batching_f = None¶

float between 0 and 1 – Message re-ordering, maximum fraction of pools that can be sent in one round.

Default: 0.5.

batching_nmin = None¶

int – Message re-ordering, minimum of message that must always be in pools.

Default: 5.

batching_t_interval = None¶

int – message re-ordering, batching interval, in milliseconds (i.e. in SimPy simulation time).

Default: 1 minute.

communication_latency = None¶

int – Latency of message delivery in the network (simulated with SimPy).

Default: 20.

corruption_ratio = None¶

float between 0 and 1 – The percentage of corrupted nodes in the network.

Default: 0.3.

dummypol_deltar = None¶

int – Dummy messages and Controlled Traffic rates, number of rounds on which the controlled traffic rate equation is relaxed.

Default: 8.

dummypol_fdum = None¶

float between 0 and 1 – Dummy messages and Controlled Traffic rates, fraction of neighbors pools in which to insert a dummy at each round.

Default: 0.8.

nb_nodes = None¶

int – Number of nodes in the network.

Default: 7.

rtprop_policy_max_hop_count = None¶

int – Route proposal policy, maximum length of a route.

Default: None.

If set to 0 or None, this parameter is automatically set to the smallest integer so that any node is ensured to obtain a route towards any other (i.e. the longest shortest path in the topo graph)

rtprop_policy_max_routes = None¶

int – Route proposal policy, maximum number of routes per receiver.

Default: 3.

rtprop_policy_p_reaccept = None¶

float between 0 and 1 – Route proposal policy, probability of accepting a second route towards an already known receiver.

Default: 0.5.

rtprop_policy_p_replace = None¶

float between 0 and 1 – Route proposal policy, probability to “replace” a known route with a newly learned one.

Default: 0.25.

secparam = None¶

int – The cryptographic security parameter of the network. Typically, 80, 128, or 256.

Default: 128.

topology_graph = None¶

networkx.Graph – The topology graph for the simulation. If left to None, one is randomly generated.

Default: None.
